qas.question: What group settled in Iceland during this period?
Who was king of the Franks in 899?
In what region of modern-day France did the Vikings settle?
What group was defeated at the Battle of Lechfeld?
In what year did the Battle of Lechfeld occur?

context: The breakup of the Carolingian Empire was accompanied by invasions, migrations, and raids by external foes. The Atlantic and northern shores were harassed by <a0_0>the Vikings<a0_0/>, who also raided the British Isles and settled there as well as in Iceland. In 911, the Viking chieftain Rollo (d. c. 931) received permission from the Frankish King <a1_0>Charles the Simple<a1_0/> (r. 898–922) to settle in what became <a2_0>Normandy<a2_0/>.[Q] The eastern parts of the Frankish kingdoms, especially Germany and Italy, were under continual <a3_0>Magyar<a3_0/> assault until the invader's defeat at the Battle of Lechfeld in <a4_0>955<a4_0/>. The breakup of the Abbasid dynasty meant that the Islamic world fragmented into smaller political states, some of which began expanding into Italy and Sicily, as well as over the Pyrenees into the southern parts of the Frankish kingdoms.
